text: Hello. I tried export blog and import on HubSpot. {{content.previous_post_featured_image}} and few next and prev variables not working. I would like to point out that when I’m creating blog post ( not importing) those variables works. Someone had problem like that? How to fix it ? Thank you :)

Hi Mark and Stan, thank you for your replies. Truly appreciate it. So originally I wanted to extract data related to what service a user booked, if they completed their service, the date that the service was booked etc. Hence why we tried using behavioral events. Now with this limitation I don’t think I can pull that data. I might only be able to pull default data such as name, last name, email. Correct?
I was thinking about adding users to segmented static lists depending on what they book or what actions they take via the API as a workaround. Thoughts? :thinking_face: Thank so much for your help

<@U0302FC6ZGD> while I think name and email would still be a great starting point, there’s no reason you couldn’t use the data present in the booking software in tandem with HubSpot. It’s hard to give specific recommendations without knowing the specific data model for the booking information and the strategy for how you would like to leverage the data, but I would imagine some combination of custom fields at the contact level, timeline events, list membership, and workflows could get the job done.

Hello HubSpot fam.  Wanted to know if there is anyone who has implemented a good dev-->staging-->publish to prod routine.
• I see the sandbox feature that syncs to sandbox (but doesn't sync content)
• I see content staging, but it looks like it creates a clone of the page
can anyone share a good process that works for them in their company for dev/staging/prod
Mi Hark thank’s I’ll do some research on the options you mentioned :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you!

Sandbox is only available to Enterprise accounts I think.

Besides a solid git/versioning setup with main deploying to theme (and maybe some stuff ofc) we have development happen in the client portal.

Need to set the development themes to be not available for new content so as to not have content running on mixed themes which is a major PITA.

Staging documents/web pages would be great for a larger overhaul, you probably need to do some or most content migration by hand depending on changes, but that's more of a content people problem.

Now that I think of having to do some major update on a running service it'd be something of a juggling act in any case.
HubSpot/React folk — thoughts are welcome!
I am "content people ":cry:
and "developer people"
we are on an enterprise acct btw
Anyone particularly attached to a specific headless CMS for any projects as well? What might that be?
have you found a way to get content onto sandbox in bulk
has anyone had luck migrating actual content (pages, assets, files) over to a sandbox instance
Hey Max, only way you can really do this is via the pages API, not the CLI.
CTAs are also not officially supported, but apparently there is an undocumented API you may be able to figure out using your devtools while using the CTA tool UI.
so close to a grown up enterprise level CMS
just need an intelligent separation of dev|QA|prod
I hope it becomes easier for all of us
<@U26BLKGE4> the API won't pull the assets/images though, correct?

You can, you would just need to use the files API. Additionally, I would suggest you look into the content staging tool within the HubSpot portal, that’s been the traditional way to handle dev and QA. My workflow, and I’d wager most others, does not hinge on having complete duplicates of the site in separate environments the way you might with WordPress or other open-source monolithic CMSs. Instead, theme asset development happens in sandbox environments, those assets are then move to the “production” portal, and applied to content objects (website and landing pages) in the content staging tool, tested, and then published.
thank you. will look into that

<@U02PDLZTRPX> I actually just posted an answer on the forums related to this in our ongoing CMS Hub AMA.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/CMS-Hub-Ask-Me-Anything-January-24/m-p/562716/highlight/true#M27003>
thanks <@U7SL518D6>. glad I'm not the only one with the concerns
I hope this becomes easier

Hey HubSpot dev community! Just reaching out to see if anyone has any experience putting Hubl in a landing page to create conditionals for a custom contact property value to determine what is displayed on the page. The workflow for a user would be they would submit a form on a landing page and be redirected to a second landing page where content is shown depending on the value they entered into the form, based off a custom contact property. Any advice on tackling this is greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance.

Hey Kyle, I’ve done this a few times and it does come with some ‘gotchas’ unfortunately; primarily that it often takes a little bit longer for HS to save the updated properties than it does to redirect the user. There are a few ways around this, with my preferred method being to use query parameters appended to the redirect URL (landing page 2). Presumably, these pages are not accessible via search or organic traffic (users who did not fill out the form on landing page 1), so cacheing isn’t necessarily needed and therefore `{{ request.query_dict }}` variables make sense. 

Alternatively, you could add a loading spinner or otherwise delay the redirect until the data has been stored in the CRM, but even then I’m not sure if there may be a delay between when the form submission is received and when the contact object at the page level changes.
I'm trying to pull some deal properties into a custom module however it's returning null when I print it / anyone see some errors here?
I left this bank because I wanted access to the whole object ...
Are you looking in the module preview or on a page? I’ve found some of these vars don’t render correctly in the module preview window.
Is there anyway to export a website from one HubSpot account and import it into another?
